wikipedia_page.main: Geoffrey Huw Davies, (born in Eastbourne, 18 February 1959) is an English rugby union player, who played as fly-half. He attended King Edwards VI College, Stourbridge, in the West Midlands. He played for Wasps RFC and for England. As of 2017, he is Scarlets' strength conditioning coach after having been serving a similar role within his former club.

response: | Rob Andrew, Mark Bailey, Huw Davies, Jeff Probyn, Paul Rendall, Kevin Simms

link_mentions.page: 1984 England rugby union tour of South Africa
1979 England rugby union tour of Japan, Fiji and Tonga
response: England did not award full international caps for the matches against Japan, Fiji and Tonga and the tourists played under the name of England XV rather than England in those games. The Welsh referee Clive Norling travelled with the party and refereed five of the matches. The leading tour points scorer was Huw Davies, with 60 points, and the leading try-scorers were John Carleton (9 tries) and Mike Slemen (7 tries).
Hugh or Huw Davies may refer to:
* Huw Davies (rugby union) (born 1959), English rugby union player
* Huw Davies (British artist), a British filmmaker and photographer currently working as a lens media at the University of Derby
* Huw Davies, author of Bunny, a webcomic
* Huw Davies (actor), Welsh actor, in The Worst Journey in the World
